hints.content: Start by understanding the structure of the DataFrame. It has four columns: student_id, name, age, and grade. Pay attention to the data types of each column, especially the grade column, which is currently a float.

To convert the grade from float to int, you will need to use a method that changes the data type of a specific column in the DataFrame. Think about what functions or methods are available in libraries like pandas.

When converting data types, consider how the conversion might affect the values. For instance, converting 73.0 to an integer will result in 73, but be aware of how rounding might work with other float values.
Before making any changes, it's a good idea to check the current data types of the DataFrame columns. You can use a method that returns the data types of all columns in the DataFrame.
Once you identify the grade column, look for a way to apply a transformation to it. In pandas, you might use a method that allows you to specify the column and the new data type.
Remember that modifying the DataFrame in place can be useful. Look for options that allow you to change the column without needing to create a new DataFrame.
After converting the grade column, ensure that the DataFrame maintains its original structure and that the other columns remain unchanged. You can print the DataFrame to verify this.
Consider edge cases, such as what happens if the grade column contains NaN values or other unexpected float values. Think about how you would handle these cases during conversion.
Check the final output format. Ensure that the DataFrame is displayed in the same format as shown in the example, with the correct data types applied.
You are almost there! Use the appropriate method to convert the grade column to integers. Make sure to check your DataFrame after the conversion to confirm the changes.
